test-case.name: quantExpr-1
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and addition expression. Returns false

test-case.name: quantExpr-2
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and addition expression. Returns true

test-case.name: quantExpr-3
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and a subtraction expression. Returns false

test-case.name: quantExpr-4
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and a subtraction expression. Returns true

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and a multiplication expression.

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and a division expression.

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and a division (idiv) expression.

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and usage of avg function expression.

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and usage of string function expression.

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and use of lofical expression (and).

test-case.name: quantExpr-17
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword and and use of string data.

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword with multiple variables and addition expression

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword with multiple variables and subtraction expression

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword with multiple variables and multiplication expression

test-case.name: quantExpr-22
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword with multiple variables and division (idiv) operation.

test-case.name: quantExpr-23
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword with multiple variables, and string function.
test-case.test: some $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies fn:string($x) = fn:string($y)

test-case.name: quantExpr-24
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:integer type
test-case.test: some $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies xs:integer($x) = xs:integer($y)

test-case.name: quantExpr-25
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:decimal type
test-case.test: some $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies xs:decimal($x) = xs:decimal($y)

test-case.name: quantExpr-26
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:float type
test-case.test: some $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies xs:float($x) = xs:float($y)

test-case.name: quantExpr-27
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:double type
test-case.test: some $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies xs:double($x) = xs:double($y)

test-case.name: quantExpr-28
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:boolean type
test-case.test: some $x in ("true", "false"), $y in ("false","true") satisfies xs:boolean($x) = xs:boolean($y)

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:dateTime type

test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:date type

test-case.name: quantexpr-53
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword with multiple variables, and string function.
test-case.test: every $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies fn:string($x) = fn:string($y)

test-case.name: quantexpr-54
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:integer type
test-case.test: every $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies xs:integer($x) = xs:integer($y)

test-case.name: quantexpr-55
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:decimal type
test-case.test: every $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies xs:decimal($x) = xs:decimal($y)

test-case.name: quantexpr-56
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:float type
test-case.test: every $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies xs:float($x) = xs:float($y)

test-case.name: quantexpr-57
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:double type
test-case.test: every $x in (1,2,3), $y in (4,5,6) satisfies xs:double($x) = xs:double($y)

test-case.name: quantexpr-58
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:boolean type
test-case.test: every $x in ("true", "false"), $y in ("false","true") satisfies xs:boolean($x) = xs:boolean($y)

test-case.name: quantexpr-59
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:dateTime type

test-case.name: quantExpr-60
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword, use of multiple variable and the xs:date type

test-case.name: quantexpr-61
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword that binds the declared variables to an xs:integer type.
test-case.test: some $x as xs:integer in (1, 2, 3) , $y as xs:integer in (2, 3, 4) satisfies $x + $y = 4

test-case.name: quantexpr-62
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword that binds the declared variable to an xs:string type.
test-case.test: some $x as xs:string in ("cat","dog","rat") satisfies fn:string-length($x) = 3

test-case.name: quantexpr-63
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword that binds the declared variable to an xs:string type.
test-case.test: every $x as xs:string in ("cat","dog","rat") satisfies fn:string-length($x) = 3

test-case.name: quantexpr-64
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "every" keyword that binds the declared variable to an xs:string and xs:integer type respectively.
test-case.test: every $x as xs:string in ("cat","dog","rat"), $y as xs:integer in (3, 3, 3) satisfies fn:string-length($x) = $y

test-case.name: quantexpr-65
test-case.description: Simple quantified expression using "some" keyword that binds the declared variable to an xs:integer and xs:float type respectively.
test-case.test: some $x as xs:integer in (1, 2, 3), $y as xs:float in (xs:float(2), xs:float(3)) satisfies $x + $y = 5

test-case.name: quantexpr-66
test-case.description: Error cose (omitted "or" operator) which crashed Saxon

test-case.name: quantexpr-67
test-case.description: Another cose (added "or" operator) which crashed Saxon

test-case.name: quantexpr-68
test-case.description: A variant of a case (added "or" operator) which crashed Saxon

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-1
test-case.description: 'every': EBV can't be extracted from xs:QName.

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-2
test-case.description: 'some': EBV can't be extracted from xs:QName.

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-3
test-case.description: $foo has static type xs:integer; which cannot be compared to xs:string.

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-4
test-case.description: $foo has static type xs:integer; which cannot be compared to xs:string.

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-5
test-case.description: A some-quantification applied on fn:count().

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-6
test-case.description: A some-quantification applied on fn:count().

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-7
test-case.description: some-quantification combined with fn:boolean().
test-case.test: some $i in subsequence((0, 1, 2, current-time()), 1, 3) satisfies boolean($i treat as xs:integer)

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-8
test-case.description: every-quantification combined with fn:boolean().
test-case.test: every $i in subsequence((1, 2, 3, current-time()), 1, 3) satisfies boolean($i treat as xs:integer)

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-9
test-case.description: every-quantification combined with empty variable binding.

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-10
test-case.description: some-quantification combined with empty variable binding.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `some $foo in 1 satisfies true()`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `every $foo in 1 satisfies true()`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `not(some $foo in 1 satisfies false())`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `not(every $foo in 1 satisfies false())`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `some $foo in 1 satisfies 1`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `every $foo in 1 satisfies 1`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `some $foo in 1 satisfies "a string"`.

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWithout-18
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `every $foo in 1 satisfies "a string"`.

test-case.description: A binding in a 'some' quantification shadows global variables.

test-case.description: A binding in a 'some' quantification shadows global variables.

test-case.description: A binding in a 'every' quantification shadows global variables.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `some $var in (1, 2, 3) satisfies $var eq 3`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `every $aaa in (3, 3, 3), $bbb in (3, 3, 3) satisfies $aaa + $bbb eq 6`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `not(every $var in (1, 2, 3) satisfies $var eq 3)`.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `some $var in (1, 2, 3) satisfies $var eq 3`.

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-1
test-case.description: Every-quantification carrying type declarations(cardinalities have no impact).

test-case.description: Every-quantification; the empty-sequence() cannot have an occurrence indicator.

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-8
test-case.description: Every-quantification; the empty-sequence() cannot have an occurrence indicator.

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-9
test-case.description: Some-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.

modified.change: prevent over-eager optimization. If $a is a singleton then the EBV of count($a) is optimizable to true(), and 'some X satisfies true() is always true if X is non-empty

test-case.test: some $a as xs:anyURI in (1 to 5) satisfies $a - 10

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-10
test-case.description: Every-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.

modified.change: prevent over-eager optimization. If $a is a singleton then the EBV of count($a) is optimizable to true(). and 'every X satisfies true()' is true for any sequence X.

test-case.test: every $a as xs:anyURI in (1 to 5) satisfies $a - 10

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-11
test-case.description: Every-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.
test-case.test: every $a as empty-sequence() in (1, 2), $b as xs:integer in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-12
test-case.description: Every-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.
test-case.test: some $a as empty-sequence() in (1, 2), $b as xs:integer in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-13
test-case.description: Every-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.
test-case.test: every $a as xs:integer+ in (1, 2), $b as xs:string* in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-14
test-case.description: Some-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.
test-case.test: some $a as xs:integer+ in (1, 2), $b as xs:string* in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-15
test-case.description: Some-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.
test-case.test: some $a as item()* in (1, 2), $b as xs:string in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-16
test-case.description: Some-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.
test-case.test: every $a as item()* in (1, 2), $b as xs:string in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-17
test-case.description: Every-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.
test-case.test: every $a as xs:integer+ in (1, 2), $b as xs:integer in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-18
test-case.description: Every-quantification carrying invalid type declarations.
test-case.test: every $a as item()* in (1, 2), $b as xs:integer in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-19
test-case.description: No 'at' declaration is allowed in 'some'-quantification.
test-case.test: some $a as item() at $p in (1, 2) satisfies $a

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-20
test-case.description: No 'at' declaration is allowed in 'every'-quantification.
test-case.test: every $a as item() at $p in (1, 2) satisfies $a

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-21
test-case.description: Every-quantification with type-declaration. An implementation supporting the static typing feature may raise XPTY0004.
test-case.test: every $a as empty-sequence() in (), $b as xs:integer in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-22
test-case.description: Every-quantification with type-declaration. An implementation supporting the static typing feature may raise XPTY0004.
test-case.test: not(some $a as empty-sequence() in (), $b as xs:integer in $a satisfies $b)

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-23
test-case.description: Every-quantification with type-declaration.
test-case.test: every $a as xs:integer in (1, 2), $b as xs:integer in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: K-QuantExprWith-24
test-case.description: Every-quantification with type-declaration.
test-case.test: some $a as xs:integer in (1, 2), $b as xs:integer in $a satisfies $b

test-case.name: cbcl-every-001
test-case.description: Test optimization when the domain may be empty and return type is a value
test-case.test: every $x in (1 to 10)[. div 2 = 11] satisfies false()

test-case.name: cbcl-some-001
test-case.description: Test optimization where the domain may be empty and the return type a value
test-case.test: some $x in (1 to 10)[. div 2 = 11] satisfies true()

test-case.name: cbcl-every-002
test-case.description: Tests optimization of every $x in .... satisfies true()
test-case.test: every $x in (1 to 10)[. mod 2 = 0] satisfies true()
